comments.body: The `-B` doesn't change anything anyway, right? conda already does pyc compilation that for us... ?

Looking at other `bob` packages, I do not see any `.pyc` files which means `-B` works as intended.
I added the `-B` option since `conda` was failing to compile `bob` packages with Python 3. It was complaining that the `__pycache__` folder already exists.
I believe they only do `pyc` compilation on [Python 2.x only](https://github.com/conda/conda-build/blob/8feeb6ba2585fa6866df9fdff628a3b34b74200d/conda_build/post.py#L161-L162).

I tried to package `bob.io.matlab` without the `-B` option and here is what I get:

```
.
└── python3.5
    └── site-packages
        ├── bob
        │   ├── blitz
        │   │   └── __pycache__
        │   │       ├── extension.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │       └── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   ├── core
        │   │   ├── __pycache__
        │   │   │   ├── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │   │   └── log.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │   └── random
        │   │       └── __pycache__
        │   │           └── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   ├── extension
        │   │   └── __pycache__
        │   │       ├── boost.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │       ├── cmake.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │       ├── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │       ├── pkgconfig.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │       └── utils.cpython-35.pyc
        │   ├── io
        │   │   ├── base
        │   │   │   └── __pycache__
        │   │   │       └── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │   ├── matlab
        │   │   │   ├── bobskin.cpp
        │   │   │   ├── bobskin.h
        │   │   │   ├── data
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_1d_cplx.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_1d.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_2d_cplx.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_2d.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_3d_cplx.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_3d.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_4d_cplx.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_4d.mat
        │   │   │   │   ├── test_cell.mat
        │   │   │   │   └── test.mat
        │   │   │   ├── file.cpp
        │   │   │   ├── file.h
        │   │   │   ├── __init__.py
        │   │   │   ├── _library.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
        │   │   │   ├── main.cpp
        │   │   │   ├── __pycache__
        │   │   │   │   ├── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │   │   │   └── test.cpython-35.pyc
        │   │   │   ├── test.py
        │   │   │   ├── utils.cpp
        │   │   │   ├── utils.h
        │   │   │   ├── version.cpp
        │   │   │   └── version.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
        │   │   └── __pycache__
        │   │       └── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        │   └── __pycache__
        │       └── __init__.cpython-35.pyc
        └── bob.io.matlab-2.0.4-py3.5.egg-info
            ├── dependency_links.txt
            ├── not-zip-safe
            ├── PKG-INFO
            ├── requires.txt
            ├── SOURCES.txt
            └── top_level.txt
```

You can see that these `__pycache__` folders conflict with other `bob` packages.

And here is what I get with the `-B` option:

```
.
└── python3.5
    └── site-packages
        ├── bob
        │   └── io
        │       └── matlab
        │           ├── bobskin.cpp
        │           ├── bobskin.h
        │           ├── data
        │           │   ├── test_1d_cplx.mat
        │           │   ├── test_1d.mat
        │           │   ├── test_2d_cplx.mat
        │           │   ├── test_2d.mat
        │           │   ├── test_3d_cplx.mat
        │           │   ├── test_3d.mat
        │           │   ├── test_4d_cplx.mat
        │           │   ├── test_4d.mat
        │           │   ├── test_cell.mat
        │           │   └── test.mat
        │           ├── file.cpp
        │           ├── file.h
        │           ├── __init__.py
        │           ├── _library.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
        │           ├── main.cpp
        │           ├── test.py
        │           ├── utils.cpp
        │           ├── utils.h
        │           ├── version.cpp
        │           └── version.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
        └── bob.io.matlab-2.0.4-py3.5.egg-info
            ├── dependency_links.txt
            ├── not-zip-safe
            ├── PKG-INFO
            ├── requires.txt
            ├── SOURCES.txt
            └── top_level.txt
```
Sorry, I'm not seeing how they conflict. Could you please explain clearly what the problem is here? Do the tests fail? Does the package still work ok?

for example, `bob.io.base` gets packages and has the folder `lib/python3.5/site-packages/bob/io/__pycache__` in it. Now when I want to package `bob.io.matlab`, this one also has the the folder `lib/python3.5/site-packages/bob/io/__pycache__` which needs to copied. `conda` will try to copy this folder again and exits with an error like this (https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/858).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  number: 0
  skip: true  # [not linux]
  script: python -B setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt

requirements:
